title: Rosey the Robot
description: The Jetsons hire a robot maid.

title: A Date with Jet Screamer
description: Judy enters a song writing contest and wins a date with Jet Screamer, much to George's chagrin. That evening he follows his daughter and the flamboyant rock star to the concert hall where he puts on a mega show, singing Judy's song "Eep Opp Ork Ah Ah".

title: Jetsons Nite Out
description: Mr. Spacely has tickets to the football game, and he invites George to come along. So, they fool their wives into thinking they were working late, and duck out to the game. It all goes according to plan, until they return home to their infuriated better halves.

title: The Space Car
description: A trip to the local car dealership to buy a new car goes south when George and Jane get mixed up in a crime like never before and are mistaken for an escaped convict and his shapely partner.

roles.char: Test Driver on Molecular Motors Video

title: The Coming of Astro
description: Elroy finds a dog and brings him home, even though his father is against having a dog.

title: The Good Little Scouts
description: George reluctantly agrees to lead Elroy's scout troop on their camping trip on the moon. He wasn't too thrilled about it, but since Mr. Spacely's son Arthur is also a scout member, George jumped at the opportunity to appease his boss. They're not on the moon one hour when George and Arthur find themselves lost.

title: The Flying Suit
description: George thinks that Elroy has invented a flying pill that actually works.

title: Rosey's Boyfriend
description: Rosey begins a romance with the janitor's robot assistant.

title: Elroy's TV Show
description: A TV show producer discovers Elroy and Astro in the park, and casts them in a brand new, original series: "The Adventures of Spaceboy Zoom and His Dog, Astro".

title: Uniblab
description: George is confident he will get a promotion, but things do not go as planned at all.

title: A Visit from Grandpa
description: The Jetsons are visited by George's zany grandfather, Montague.

title: Astro's Top Secret
description: Rival company boss Cogswell believes that George has invented a device that allows Astro to fly.

title: Las Venus
description: Lovebirds George and Jane go on a second honeymoon.

title: Elroy's Pal
description: TV hero The Great Nimbus comes to visit Elroy.

title: Test Pilot
description: After George thinks that he is dying, he decides to become a test pilot for an indestructible suit.

title: Millionaire Astro
description: A millionaire tries to take Astro away from the Jetsons, claiming that Astro is really his dog.

title: The Little Man
description: George accidentally shrinks himself with one of Mr. Spacely's machines and can't get big again after the machine malfunctions.

title: Jane's Driving Lesson
description: Jane's driving lessons turn dangerous when she gets involved with a gangster.

title: G.I. Jetson
description: George gets drafted into the U.S. Space Guard Reserves at Camp Nebula for two weeks. At first, George is hoping that this will allow him time away from Mr. Spacely. But George is dismayed to find Mr. Spacely to be his commanding officer!

title: Miss Solar System
description: Jane signs up for a beauty pageant and is shocked to find that her husband is one of the judges.

title: Private Property
description: George discovers that the building of one of their competitors was built six inches onto Mr. Spacely's land.

title: Dude Planet
description: The Jetsons vacation on a dude planet.

title: TV or Not TV
description: The television becomes a source of contention in the Jetson household.

title: Elroy's Mob
description: Elroy becomes involved with a gang of mobsters.

title: Elroy Meets Orbitty
description: A lovable creature becomes the newest member of the Jetson family.

title: Rosie Come Home
description: Rosey runs away from home when she thinks the Jetsons are going to replace her.

title: Solar Snoops
description: George foils attempt by Cogswell to steal a new Spacely Sprocket secret.

title: Judy's Birthday Surprise
description: Finding herself alone on the night of her 16th birthday, Judy tells her robot diary all about the events that lead up to her special day.

title: Instant Replay
description: A new invention gives George the power to edit history.

title: Fugitive Fleas
description: Musical fleas escape from their circus life by hitching a ride on Astro.

title: S'No Relative
description: The Jetsons mistake an escaped creature for a relative until scientists recapture him.

title: Dance Time
description: George tries a new pair of experimental shoes that dance on their own.

title: Judy Takes Off
description: When Jane and Mrs. Spacely compete for the same award, Spacely employs devious means to discredit Jane.

title: Winner Takes All
description: Out-of-shape George inadvertently volunteers for a health club fitness contest.

title: The Cosmic Courtship of George and Jane
description: George must woo Jane again after she learns that their marriage isn't legal.

title: High Moon
description: Elroy is obsessed with watching a TV spy show until he visits a Western town.

title: Little Bundle of Trouble
description: Astro becomes suspicious of a "lost baby" who is really a jewel thief in disguise.

title: Elroy in Wonderland
description: Elroy helps some discarded tools prove that they're not obsolete.

title: The Swiss Family Jetson
description: After being laid off of work George buys into a scheme called "DIGIFARM" and moves to the farthest planetoid in the Galaxy. Arriving they run out of fuel and crash-land so the Jetsons have to use survival to make their new home a paradise but developers take notice and move in.

title: Rip-Off Rosie
description: Rosey eats a faulty lug nut, causing her to steal things.

title: Fantasy Planet
description: On Fantasy Planet, the Jetsons discover that fame and fortune can be disappointing.

title: Space Bong
description: George is kidnapped by a sultry spy who mistakes him for a secret agent.

title: Haunted Halloween
description: Elroy is distraught when Orbitty suddenly disappears on Halloween.

title: Astro's Big Moment
description: George can't please anyone when he judges a dog contest.

title: The Wrong Stuff
description: Elroy and Astro wander onto an unmanned rocket just before it departs on a five-year mission.

title: Team Spirit
description: Elroy's energized cookies help George save his job during a company spaceball game.

title: Future Tense
description: Jane's new designer glasses let her see into the future.

title: Far-Out Father
description: For a Father's Day project, Elroy films George, who also uses the camera to follow a lovesick Astro.

title: Dog Daze Afternoon
description: A mix-up of computer discs causes George to act like a dog.

title: Grandpa and the Galactic Golddigger
description: A female thief mistakes Grandpa Jetson for rich Mr. Spacely and woos him to steal his "fortune."

title: Robot's Revenge
description: George's life is thrown into chaos when all robots refuse his orders.

title: To Tell the Truth
description: George learns the hard way that honesty is the best policy.

title: Boy George
description: George's temporary smallness lands him a large account.

roles.char: School Patrol robots, Executive Vice President

title: Judy's Elopement
description: George is frantic when he thinks Judy has eloped with Mr. Spacely's nephew.

title: The Century's Best
description: Love overcomes selfishness when the Jetsons compete for a prize.

title: A Jetson Christmas Carol
description: What do Santa Claus and George Jetson have in common? They both have to work on Christmas eve! That mean old Mr. Spacely forces George to work late, while the family wonders what has happened to him, while Astro opens one of his presents early, breaks it, accidentally swallows a piece of it (a Spacely Sprockett) and becomes very ill. It seems the Jetsons may lose their Tiny Tim-like dog. Plus, Mr. Spacely is visited by his old partner, Jacob Marsley, who tells him of three spirits that will visit him. And they do, first the Past ghost robot who shows him young Spacely picking on young George, Present (which is an Xmas present) shows him of dying Astro, and Future shows the Jetsons very rich after sueing Mr. Spacely. When Spacely wakes up after seeing all this, he's a changed man! A sadder, wiser, nicer and happier Cosmo Spacely! At least until the next episode.

title: Crime Games
description: A gang of hoods plan to frame George for a robbery at Spacely's warehouse.

title: ASTROnomical I.Q
description: Elroy's latest invention turns Astro into a super-genius.

title: 9 to 5 to 9
description: Desperate to win the affections of the new hunk at school, Judy gets a job (three of them actually) in order to buy her own car.

title: Invisibly Yours, George
description: Spacely's nephew develops a spot removal spray that accidentally turns George invisible.

title: Father/Daughter Dance
description: Judy dreads having to dance with her father at an upcoming school event.

title: Clean as a Hound's Tooth
description: A mix-up at the dentist office gives George dog teeth with a mind of their own.

title: Wedding Bells for Rosey
description: Under a strange new law, Mac has to marry another robot or face deactivation. Rosie reluctantly steps up to the task.

title: The Odd Pod
description: Jane's new plant almost eats the family out of house and home, literally.

title: Two Many Georges
description: George has himself cloned so he can enjoy his vacation and help his family with their plans at the same time. Things don't quite turn out as he expected, however when the clone George proves to be his intellectual superior.

title: Spacely for a Day
description: George is chosen to be Mr. Spacely's replacement while he's on vacation, and nearly runs them out of business.
